channel.title: Help there please
channel.description:
Alright i get this error when I run the compiler then after the runserver
[img]http://img253.imageshack.us/img253/5604/errorkn7.png[/img]
I know what it means, that they can't run both on the same port at the same time, but how to fix this ? Cause now my server doesn't work :(

item.title: Help there please
item.dc:creator: @loler loler
item.description:
@loler wrote:

Testscape Sources Compiler now runs server after compiling, OR if your using a different source, Make sure you CLOSE the compiler then run the “runserver” DOS. Hope that helps. GL

Read full topic

item.title: Help there please
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Yes, its like this:

The server uses the port going out,
The client uses the port going in.

You have another application using the port. Even if you close the application, it can still be running and using the port. Even if you end it from the task manager, the java.net.Server &java.net.Client sockets will still be running. Solution: Dissconnect all internet services you have entirely and KEEP them dissconnected.

Read full topic

Any more sulutions o_O ?

item.title: Help there please
item.dc:creator: @Slain Slain
item.description:
@Slain wrote:

if you want to change the port the server runs on, click on server.java and search 43594 and change it to a port not in use =-)
